feature.name: daily_wage_calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily_wage_calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Discrepancy Between Leave Policy and Payroll Daily Wage Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the formula in the leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is being superseded by the payroll configuration. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.gap_statement: The EOS gratuity calculator requires enhancement to dynamically handle leap year calculations and automatically recognize 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485). Detailed calculation breakdown shows system uses a specific formula: daily wage divided by 30, with 21 days per year for first 5 years and 30 days per year after, prorating partial years by days/365.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation may show slight variations from manual calculations due to precise system formula
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential need for more transparent gratuity calculation method to align with manual expectations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy in Leap Year
known_issues.issue_explanation: System may not consistently handle leap year days (Feb 29th) when calculating total service days for gratuity computation. The ticket revealed a minor difference in day counting: client calculated 913 total days (including leap day), while system initially showed 912 days, resulting in a slight gratuity amount variation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Potential inconsistency in handling February 29th when calculating total service duration for gratuity calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for transparent documentation about leap year day inclusion in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing employee service tenure, potentially affecting gratuity calculation accuracy. The extra day discrepancy impacts the final gratuity amount calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation includes an extra day in total service duration computation
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential precision issue in days calculation method for employee service tenure

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Report Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly leave salary accruals can vary due to different working days per month
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Independent daily wage configurations prevent consistent salary calculations across leave and proration scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists to standardize calculations across different payroll scenarios.

known_issues.title: Salary Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. The system only prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past, causing incorrect full salary calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration logic does not handle future departure dates correctly during payroll processing
known_issues.gap_statement: Product lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Module communication enhancement needed to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Daily Wage Calculation Using Non-Standard Divisor
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates daily wage for unpaid leave using a custom divisor of 30.42 days instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses 30.42 days divisor, not calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains accurate, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system has a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy calculations. This means unpaid leave deductions are calculated using a system-wide setting instead of policy-specific methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Incorrectly Displayed
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not match the month of leave occurrence
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for variations in actual worked days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations.
limitations.impact: Leave policy formulas become non-editable and are greyed out when overridden by payroll settings

limitations.title: Leave Deduction Calculation Dependent on Salary Config Timing
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions are calculated based on the salary configuration existing at the time of leave request creation. Changes to salary configuration after leave request may not automatically update deduction calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential payroll calculation inaccuracies if salary configurations change after leave requests are submitted

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service gratuity benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision in Daily Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations (basic + allowances / 30) consistently produce slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision limitations.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in end of service calculations

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, meaning mid-month departures do not automatically include current month's leave balance
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month will not have current month's leave days automatically included in End of Service (EOS) calculation

limitations.title: Service Duration Day Counting Rules
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are processed
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculations

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Based on Monthly Working Days
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary accrual is calculated using a 'working days' method, which means the daily wage varies based on the number of working days in each month
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary amounts will differ month-to-month due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation inconsistencies and manual configuration required to match client expectations

limitations.title: Working Days Calculation Based on Work Week
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration may appear different depending on how work week is configured for each employee or organization

limitations.title: Limited Proration Date Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is only accurate for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential payroll calculation errors for employees with upcoming departure dates

limitations.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention to resolve.

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction accuracy when public holidays or working days configuration changes

limitations.title: Payroll and Time Off Module Integration
limitations.limitation_statement: Time Off module does not automatically send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation
limitations.impact: Prevents accurate retroactive recalculation of salary deductions when configuration changes occur

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll system uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for daily wage calculations, which may not align with calendar months
limitations.impact: Deductions may exceed expected monthly salary amounts

limitations.title: February Days Calculation Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system may default to 31 days when calculating daily rates, potentially causing display inaccuracies in leap years like February with 29 days.
limitations.impact: Potential user confusion due to incorrect remarks display, though actual calculations remain mathematically correct

limitations.title: Global Settings Supersede Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

The ticket revealed a minor difference in day counting: client calculated 913 total days (including leap day), while system initially showed 912 days, resulting in a slight gratuity amount variation.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing employee service tenure, potentially affecting gratuity calculation accuracy. The extra day discrepancy impacts the final gratuity amount calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Report Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. The system only prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past, causing incorrect full salary calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Using Non-Standard Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates daily wage for unpaid leave using a custom divisor of 30.42 days instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system has a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy calculations. This means unpaid leave deductions are calculated using a system-wide setting instead of policy-specific methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Incorrectly Displayed
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days divided by 12 months.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Deduction Calculation Dependent on Salary Config Timing
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions are calculated based on the salary configuration existing at the time of leave request creation. Changes to salary configuration after leave request may not automatically update deduction calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision in Daily Wage Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations (basic + allowances / 30) consistently produce slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision limitations.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, meaning mid-month departures do not automatically include current month's leave balance

claims_to_validate.title: Service Duration Day Counting Rules
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are processed

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Based on Monthly Working Days
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary accrual is calculated using a 'working days' method, which means the daily wage varies based on the number of working days in each month

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.

claims_to_validate.title: Working Days Calculation Based on Work Week
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Limited Proration Date Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is only accurate for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates

claims_to_validate.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll and Time Off Module Integration
claims_to_validate.statement: Time Off module does not automatically send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll system uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for daily wage calculations, which may not align with calendar months

claims_to_validate.title: February Days Calculation Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system may default to 31 days when calculating daily rates, potentially causing display inaccuracies in leap years like February with 29 days.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Supersede Policy-Level Configurations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
